case_vignette: a 65-year-old african american man presents to dermatology clinic for multiple non-painful, non-itchy brown spots on the face. he notes they started developing when he was 42 years old, and they have increased in number and size. sometimes he tries to remove them with a needle, but they will bleed.   physical exam reveals multiple dark, flat topped ovoid papules, and few pedunculated brown-black papules on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple non-painful, non-itchy brown spots on my face that have been increasing in number and size since I was 42 years old.
Have you had any similar skin issues in the past or any family history of skin conditions?
No, I haven't had similar skin issues in the past, and there is no family history of skin conditions.
How old are you currently?
I am 65 years old.
Have you had significant sun exposure over the years or used tanning beds?
I haven't mentioned any specific details about sun exposure or using tanning beds.
What is your skin type and have you noticed any changes in your skin texture along with the brown spots?
I haven't mentioned my skin type or any changes in the texture of my skin along with the brown spots.
Are the brown spots limited to your face or are they present on other parts of your body as well?
The brown spots are limited to my face.
Final Diagnosis: Seborrheic keratoses.
